column2: MARYLAND DMV DRIVING TEST
column6: MD

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.

column2: 2. A flashing red light:
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: Yield sign ahead

column2: 4. What does this road sign indicate?
column6: Hospital service
column8: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 5. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull the steering wheel back.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 6. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 7. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: The other answers are both correct.

column2: 8. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.

column2: 9. This sign indicates that:
column4: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column8: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 10. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column6: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
column8: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.

column2: 11. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column6: Never depend on

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: You must turn right

column2: 13. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column6: no passing zone

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 15. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may not cross the broken white line.
column6: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column8: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.

column2: 16. Drivers should:
column4: know that most drivers obey the right-of-way rules.
column6: always be prepared to yield the right-of-way.
column8: only be aggressive when drivers do not obey the right-of-way rules.

column2: 17. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 18. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column6: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 19. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
column6: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.

column2: 20. A flashing yellow light at an intersection means drivers should:
column6: slow down and proceed with caution.
column8: immediately come to a complete stop.

column2: 21. If the vehicle is equipped with air bags, seat belts:
column6: are optional.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less
column6: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column8: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane

column2: 23. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 24. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column6: It improves the vehicle stability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 25. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Danger ahead.
